snippet: Days of fierce fighting in northwestern Pakistan left 30 soldiers and nearly 100 militants dead as the army tried to wrest control of a valley from the Taliban, officials said Monday.
abstract: Four days of fierce fighting in northwestern Pakistan leaves 30 soldiers and nearly 100 militants dead as army tried to wrest control of remote, mountainous valley from Taliban and their allies.
lead_paragraph: Days of fierce fighting in northwestern Pakistan left 30 soldiers and nearly 100 militants dead as the army tried to wrest control of a valley from the Taliban, officials said Monday.
